		                    Carcinoid Tumors in the Rectum
		                    Treatment of GI carcinoid tumors in the rectum may include the following:         -  Endoscopic surgery (resection) for tumors that are smaller than 1 centimeter.    - Surgery (resection) for tumors that are larger than 2 centimeters or that have spread to the muscle layer of the rectal wall.
